member.name: T:Flurl.QueryParamCollection
member.summary: Represents a URL query as a key-value dictionary. Insertion order is preserved.

member.name: M:Flurl.QueryParamCollection.ToString
member.summary: Returns serialized, encoded query string. Insertion order is preserved.

member.name: M:Flurl.QueryParamCollection.ToString(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns serialized, encoded query string. Insertion order is preserved.

member.name: M:Flurl.QueryParamCollection.Add(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a new query parameter.

member.name: M:Flurl.QueryParamCollection.Add(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a new query parameter, allowing you to specify whether the value is already encoded.

member.name: M:Flurl.QueryParamCollection.ContainsKey(System.String)
member.summary: True if the collection contains a query parameter with the given name.

member.name: M:Flurl.QueryParamCollection.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes all parameters of the given name.
member.returns: The number of parameters that were removed

member.name: P:Flurl.QueryParamCollection.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets a query parameter value by name. A query may contain multiple values of the same name (i.e. "x=1&x=2"), in which case the value is an array, which works for both getting and setting.
member.returns: The query parameter value or array of values

member.name: T:Flurl.QueryParameter
member.summary: Represents an individual name/value pair within a URL query.

member.name: M:Flurl.QueryParameter.#ctor(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a query parameter.

member.name: M:Flurl.QueryParameter.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a query parameter. Allows specifying whether string value provided has already been URL-encoded.

member.name: P:Flurl.QueryParameter.Name
member.summary: The name (left side) of the query parameter.

member.name: P:Flurl.QueryParameter.Value
member.summary: The value (right side) of the query parameter.

member.name: M:Flurl.QueryParameter.ToString(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the string ("name=value") representation of the query parameter.
member.param: Indicates whether to encode space characters with "+" instead of "%20".

member.name: T:Flurl.StringExtensions
member.summary: A set of string extension methods for working with Flurl URLs

member.name: M:Flurl.StringExtensions.AppendPathSegment(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a new Url object from the string and appends a segment to the URL path, ensuring there is one and only one '/' character as a separator.
member.returns: the resulting Url object

member.name: M:Flurl.StringExtensions.AppendPathSegments(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Appends multiple segments to the URL path, ensuring there is one and only one '/' character as a seperator.
member.returns: the Url object with the segments appended

member.name: M:Flurl.StringExtensions.AppendPathSegments(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Object})
member.summary: Appends multiple segments to the URL path, ensuring there is one and only one '/' character as a seperator.
member.returns: the Url object with the segments appended

member.name: M:Flurl.StringExtensions.SetQueryParam(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a new Url object from the string and adds a parameter to the query, overwriting the value if name exists.
member.returns: The Url object with the query parameter added

member.name: M:Flurl.StringExtensions.SetQueryParam(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new Url object from the string and adds a parameter to the query, overwriting the value if name exists.
member.param: Set to true to indicate the value is already URL-encoded (typically false)
member.returns: The Url object with the query parameter added

member.name: M:Flurl.StringExtensions.SetQueryParams(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a new Url object from the string, parses values object into name/value pairs, and adds them to the query, overwriting any that already exist.
member.param: Typically an anonymous object, ie: new { x = 1, y = 2 }
member.returns: The Url object with the query parameters added

member.name: M:Flurl.StringExtensions.RemoveQueryParam(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Url object from the string and removes a name/value pair from the query by name.
member.param: Query string parameter name to remove
member.returns: The Url object with the query parameter removed

member.name: M:Flurl.StringExtensions.RemoveQueryParams(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Creates a new Url object from the string and removes multiple name/value pairs from the query by name.
member.param: Query string parameter names to remove
member.returns: The Url object with the query parameters removed

member.name: M:Flurl.StringExtensions.RemoveQueryParams(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Creates a new Url object from the string and removes multiple name/value pairs from the query by name.
member.param: Query string parameter names to remove
member.returns: The Url object with the query parameters removed

member.name: M:Flurl.StringExtensions.SetFragment(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Set the URL fragment fluently.
member.param: The part of the URL afer #
member.returns: The Url object with the new fragment set

member.name: M:Flurl.StringExtensions.RemoveFragment(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the URL fragment including the #.
member.returns: The Url object with the fragment removed

member.name: M:Flurl.StringExtensions.ResetToRoot(System.String)
member.summary: Trims the URL to its root, including the scheme, any user info, host, and port (if specified).
member.returns: A Url object.

member.name: T:Flurl.Url
member.summary: Represents a URL that can be built fluently

member.name: P:Flurl.Url.Path
member.summary: The full absolute path part of the URL (everthing except the query and fragment).

member.name: P:Flurl.Url.Query
member.summary: The query part of the URL (after the ?, RFC 3986).

member.name: P:Flurl.Url.QueryParams
member.summary: Query parsed to name/value pairs.

member.name: P:Flurl.Url.Fragment
member.summary: The fragment part of the URL (after the #, RFC 3986).

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a Url object from a string.
member.param: The URL to use as a starting point (required)

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.ParseQueryParams(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a URL query to a QueryParamCollection dictionary.

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.Combine(System.String[])
member.summary: Basically a Path.Combine for URLs. Ensures exactly one '/' seperates each segment, and exactly on '&' seperates each query parameter. URL-encodes illegal characters but not reserved characters.

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.GetRoot(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the root URL of the given full URL, including the scheme, any user info, host, and port (if specified).

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.DecodeQueryParamValue(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes a URL-encoded query parameter value.

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.EncodeQueryParamValue(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: URL-encodes a query parameter value.
member.param: The query parameter value to encode.
If true, spaces will be encoded as + signs. Otherwise, they'll be encoded as %20.

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.EncodeIllegalCharacters(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes characters that are illegal in a URL. Does not encode reserved characters, i.e. '/', '+', etc.

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.AppendPathSegment(System.Object)
member.summary: Appends a segment to the URL path, ensuring there is one and only one '/' character as a seperator.
member.returns: the Url object with the segment appended

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.AppendPathSegments(System.Object[])
member.summary: Appends multiple segments to the URL path, ensuring there is one and only one '/' character as a seperator.
member.returns: the Url object with the segments appended

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.AppendPathSegments(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Object})
member.summary: Appends multiple segments to the URL path, ensuring there is one and only one '/' character as a seperator.
member.returns: the Url object with the segments appended

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.SetQueryParam(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a parameter to the query, overwriting the value if name exists.
member.returns: The Url object with the query parameter added

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.SetQueryParam(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a parameter to the query, overwriting the value if name exists.
member.param: Set to true to indicate the value is already URL-encoded (typically false)
member.returns: The Url object with the query parameter added

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.SetQueryParams(System.Object)
member.summary: Parses values (usually an anonymous object or dictionary) into name/value pairs and adds them to the query, overwriting any that already exist.
member.param: Typically an anonymous object, ie: new { x = 1, y = 2 }
member.returns: The Url object with the query parameters added

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.RemoveQueryParam(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a name/value pair from the query by name.
member.param: Query string parameter name to remove
member.returns: The Url object with the query parameter removed

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.RemoveQueryParams(System.String[])
member.summary: Removes multiple name/value pairs from the query by name.
member.param: Query string parameter names to remove
member.returns: The Url object with the query parameters removed

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.RemoveQueryParams(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Removes multiple name/value pairs from the query by name.
member.param: Query string parameter names to remove
member.returns: The Url object with the query parameters removed

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.SetFragment(System.String)
member.summary: Set the URL fragment fluently.
member.param: The part of the URL afer #
member.returns: The Url object with the new fragment set

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.RemoveFragment
member.summary: Removes the URL fragment including the #.
member.returns: The Url object with the fragment removed

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.IsValid
member.summary: Checks if this URL is a well-formed.
member.returns: true if this is a well-formed URL

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.IsValid(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if a string is a well-formed URL.
member.returns: true if s is a well-formed URL

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.ResetToRoot
member.summary: Resets the URL to its root, including the scheme, any user info, host, and port (if specified).
member.returns: The Url object trimmed to its root.

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.ToString
member.summary: Converts this Url object to its string representation.

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.ToString(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts this Url object to its string representation.

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.op_Implicit(Flurl.Url)~System.String
member.summary: Implicit conversion from Url to String.
member.returns: The string

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.op_Implicit(System.String)~Flurl.Url
member.summary: Implicit conversion from String to Url.
member.param: the String representation of the URL
member.returns: The string

member.name: M:Flurl.Url.op_Implicit(System.Uri)~Flurl.Url
member.summary: Implicit conversion from System.Uri to Flurl.Url.
member.returns: The string

member.name: T:Flurl.Util.CommonExtensions
member.summary: CommonExtensions for objects.

member.name: M:Flurl.Util.CommonExtensions.ToKeyValuePairs(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts an object's public properties to a collection of string-based key-value pairs. If the object happens to be an IDictionary, the IDictionary's keys and values converted to strings and returned.
member.param: The object to parse into key-value pairs

member.name: M:Flurl.Util.CommonExtensions.ToInvariantString(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a string that represents the current object, using CultureInfo.InvariantCulture where possible.

member.name: M:Flurl.Util.CommonExtensions.SplitOnFirstOccurence(System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Splits at the first occurence of the given seperator.
member.returns: Array of at most 2 strings. (1 if separator is not found.)
